newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish Polar ups '97 net profit forecast by 30 pct.
newsitem.headline: Polish Polar ups '97 net profit forecast by 30 pct.

text.p: Polish white goods maker Polar SA, whose initial public offering starts later in August, said on Tuesday its 1997 net profit should be 30 percent higher than the 5.9 million zlotys forecast in its issue prospectus.

"The 1997 sales forecast at 567 million zlotys in the issue prospectus should be exceeded by at least 30 percent. The same applies to the net profit forecast," Polar's marketing director Andrzej Krowinski said during a meeting with investors.
The firm is offering 5.4 million new shares later this month and the state is selling 1.9 million of the firm's 8.9 million shares in September.--Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
